def read_and_reformat(csv_path):
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_path,
                     sep='|',
                     encoding='iso-8859-1',
                     dtype=object,
                     header=None,
                     quoting=QUOTE_NONE,
                     names=['@paragraph@volume@chapter'])    
    df['@paragraph@volume@chapter'] = df['@paragraph@volume@chapter'].str.replace('#NAME\?', '')
    df['@paragraph@volume@chapter'] = df['@paragraph@volume@chapter'].str.strip(',')
    return df

def read_and_reformat(csv_path, encoding='iso-8859-1'):
    df1 = pd.read_csv(csv_path,
                     sep='|',
                     encoding=encoding,
                     dtype=object,
                     header=None,
                     quoting=QUOTE_NONE,
                     names=['@paragraph@volume@chapter'])    
    df1['@paragraph@volume@chapter'] = df1['@paragraph@volume@chapter'].str.replace('#NAME\?', '')
    df1['@paragraph@volume@chapter'] = df1['@paragraph@volume@chapter'].str.strip(',')
    return df1

MARCEL PROUST - À la recherche du temps perdu (In Search of Lost Time)

Valentin Louis Georges Eugène Marcel Proust (10 July 1871 – 18 November 1922) was a French novelist, critic, and essayist who wrote the monumental novel À la recherche du temps perdu (In Search of Lost Time; earlier rendered as Remembrance of Things Past), published in seven parts between 1913 and 1927. He is considered by critics and writers to be one of the most influential authors of the 20th century.
